intro: Leandra rigida, commonly known as the rigid leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
